params.note: Alternative methods for generating hPSC-derived iNPCs include sequential mesoderm to posterior intermediate mesoderm differentiation, transient iNPC induction with MET to nephron structures, direct reprogramming of fibroblasts via NPC-specific transcription factors, and short-term expansion (up to 14 d) of hPSC-derived iNPCs.
The described protocol enables stable expansion of hPSC-derived iNPCs for months with 90–95% SIX2+ purity and retained nephrogenic potential, enabling scalable manufacturing.
Transcriptome analysis shows hNPSR-v2-cultured iNPCs better resemble primary human NPCs in vivo compared to transient iNPCs.
iNPC-derived nephron organoids show minimal off-target cell types and increased maturity, including COL4A3+/COL4A4+ podocytes, compared to hPSC-derived organoids.
Improved iNPC specification enhances proximal tubule segmentation and maturity, consistent with higher-quality NPCs generating more mature nephrons.
Near-pure human iNPCs enable study of kidney development, disease, and regeneration.
Genome-wide CRISPR screens in mouse NPCs identified genes regulating self-renewal with implications for congenital kidney disease and Wilms tumor.
Genome editing can be performed directly in iNPC lines to assess functional consequences in nephron organoids.
PKD2−/− iNPCs are expandable and generate cystic nephron organoids recapitulating polycystic kidney disease phenotype.
hNPSR-v2 medium reprograms hPSC-derived or primary human fetal podocytes to an NPC-like state, revealing podocyte plasticity.
iNPC-derived nephron organoids produce podocytes with higher COL4A3 and COL4A4 expression, offering a tool to model glomerular diseases.

Limitations of iNPC-derived nephron organoids for glomerular disease modeling: (i) lack of vascularization preventing perfused glomerulus modeling; (ii) unknown formation of specialized podocyte structures (e.g., slit diaphragm).
Cultured iNPCs resemble primary human NPCs in global gene expression and developmental potential, but some differences remain.
